intro: Mesosphaerum ferrugineum, commonly known as the rusty mesosphaerum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a rough, textured surface. Mesosphaerum ferrugineum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
